sen.j: その内容は、上野国群馬郡下賛（下佐野）郷高田里の三家（ミヤケ、屯倉）の子孫が、七世父母、現在の父母等のために天地に誓願して作る旨が記され、祖先の菩提と父母の安穏を仏に祈願している。
sen.e: The content shows that the descendants of the Miyake family in Takada-no-sato, Shimosanu (Shimosano)-go, Gunma-gun, Kozuke Province would build the monument, with prayers to heaven and earth, for the past and present parents and also prayed to Buddha for the salvation of their ancestors and safety of their parents.

The content shows that the descendants of the ruling family of the Miyake (Imperial-controlled territory) in Takada no sato, Shimosanu-go (also known as Shimosano-go), Gunma County, Kozuke Province would build the monument to pray to Buddha for the salvation of their ancestors and safety of their parents by pledging to the heaven and earth, for the parents of the seventh generation, those of the time, and so on.

sen.j: 金井沢碑に刻まれる「三家」は山ノ上碑に刻まれる「佐野三家」であると考えられてきたが、最近の発掘調査により史料上知られていないミヤケの存在が確実視されているため、「三家」が「佐野三家」とは別のミヤケである可能性もある。
sen.e: "Miyake" engraved on Kanaizawano-hi has been thought to be "Sanomiyake", but with recent excavation research ensuring the existence of Miyake not found in historical records, "Miiyake" can be a different Miyake from "Sanomiyake".

Miyake' engraved on Kanaizawa no hi has been thought to be 'Sano no Miyake' (ruling family of Miyake in Sano), but with recent excavation research ensuring the existence of Miyake not found in historical records, 'Miyake' can be a different Miyake from 'Sano no Miyake.'
